required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating the Success of Habitual Multifocal Wearers When Refit With a New Lens Design
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Success of Habitual Multifocal Wearers When Refit With a New Lens Design

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to adapt existing multifocal soft lens wearers to a CONTROL lens for 2 weeks and then evaluate the success of switching them to the TEST lens, with a review after 2 weeks.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, crossover, bilateral daily wear and subject masked dispensing study. The habitual contact lenses will not be optimized. There will be no randomization of the study lenses, participants will wear the control lenses for the first wear period and the test for the second wear period. Participants will wear each study lens for 3-7 days and then attend for a prescription optimization visit. After this optimization visit they will wear each study lens for a 2-week period. During the 2-week wear period, participants will record their subjective lens-wear experience remotely.

primary_outcome.description: Subjective ratings of comfort on insertion using a 0-10 scale, in 0.5 steps (0=- painful, 10- Can't feel the lenses).

arm_group.description: All subjects will wear control lenses for two weeks and then will wear Test lenses for two weeks.
After wearing control lenses for two weeks, all subjects will wear test lenses for two weeks.
